strength_details: IBM is a globally established enterprise company with strong brand recognition
Well-defined data modeling role with clear technical focus and requirements
Opportunity to work with enterprise-scale data governance and warehousing
concern_details: No salary or compensation information disclosed
No career growth, learning budget, or advancement opportunities mentioned
Focus on traditional tools (Erwin, IBM Infosphere) rather than modern data stack
Consulting role with client-facing responsibilities may have demanding timelines
best_fit_details: Senior data engineers with 12+ years experience in data modeling and architecture
Professionals with expertise in Erwin and IBM Infosphere Data Architect tools
Candidates seeking stable enterprise environment with established data practices
probe_details: Ask about salary range, benefits, and total compensation package
Understand team structure, size, and reporting relationships
Clarify the technology stack and modernization plans
Discuss work hours, overtime expectations, and client delivery timelines
Inquire about career advancement and professional development opportunities
leverage_details: Deep expertise in Erwin and IBM Infosphere Data Architect is specialized and valuable
12+ years experience in data modeling and enterprise data architecture is rare
summary.overall_assessment: Solid enterprise data engineering opportunity at IBM with clear data modeling focus. Good for experienced professionals seeking stable corporate environment. Main concerns are lack of modern tech stack, unclear compensation, and limited growth opportunities. Best fit for data modeling specialists who value enterprise stability over cutting-edge technology.
